Prompt:
Example 1:
Cosmology (from the Greek kosmos, "world" and logia, "study of"), is the study of the origin, evolution, and eventual fate of the universe. Physical cosmology is the scholarly and scientific study of the origin, evolution, large-scale structures and dynamics, and ultimate fate of the universe, as well as the scientific laws that govern these realities.
The term cosmology was first used in English in 1656 in Thomas Blount's Glossographia, and in 1731 taken up in Latin by German philosopher Christian Wolff, in Cosmologia Generalis.
Religious or mythological cosmology is a body of beliefs based on mythological, religious, and esoteric literature and traditions of creation and eschatology.
Physical cosmology is studied by scientists, such as astronomers and physicists, as well as philosophers, such as metaphysicians, philosophers of physics, and philosophers of space and time. Because of this shared scope with philosophy, theories in physical cosmology may include both scientific and non-scientific propositions, and may depend upon assumptions that can not be tested.

Example 2:
It was believed by the principal men of Virginia that Talbot's sympathies were with the revolted colonies; but the influence of his mother, to whom he had been accustomed to defer, had hitherto proved sufficient to prevent him from openly declaring himself. His visit to England, and the delightful reception he had met with there, had weakened somewhat the ties which bound him to his native country, and he found himself in a state of indecision as humiliating as it was painful. Lord Dunmore and Colonel Wilton had each made great efforts to enlist his support, on account of his wealth and position and high personal qualities. It was hinted by one that the ancient barony of the Talbots would be revived by the king; and the gratitude of a free and grateful country, with the consciousness of having materially aided in acquiring that independence which should be the birthright of every Englishman, was eloquently portrayed by the other. When to the last plea was added the personal preference of Katharine Wilton, the balance was overcome, and the hopes of the mother were doomed to disappointment.

Using vocabulary and structure from examples, write a short paragraph about 'prehistory' targeting the same readability level (Graduate), limited to 50 words.

Using vocabulary and structure from examples, write a short paragraph about 'prehistory' targeting the same readability level (Graduate), limited to 50 words. Using vocabulary and structure from examples, write a short paragraph about 'prehistory' targeting the same readability level (Graduate), limited to 50 words. Prehistory (from the Greek pre, "before", and historia, "history") is the span of time before written records, and is often divided into the Stone Age, Bronze Age, and Iron Age. Archaeologists study prehistory by examining artifacts and other physical remains.

Using vocabulary and structure from examples, write a short paragraph about 'prehistory' targeting the same readability level (Graduate), limited to 50 words. Prehistory, the study of the human past before written records, is a scholarly and scientific discipline that encompasses archaeology, anthropology, and paleontology. It is the exploration of our species' origins, migrations, cultural developments, and interactions with the environment. Prehistorians examine artifacts, fossils, and other physical remains to reconstruct human history and understand our ancestors' behaviors, technologies, and social structures.

Because of this shared scope with philosophy, theories in physical cosmology may include both scientific and non-scientific propositions, and may depend upon assumptions that can not be tested.

Example 2:
It was believed by the principal men of Virginia that Talbot's sympathies were with the revolted colonies; but the influence of his mother, to whom he had been accustomed to defer, had hitherto proved sufficient to prevent him from openly declaring himself. His visit to England, and the delightful reception he had met with there, had weakened somewhat the ties which bound him to his native country, and he found himself in a state of indecision as humiliating as it was painful. Lord Dunmore and Colonel Wilton had each made great efforts to enlist his support, on account of his wealth and position and high personal qualities. It was hinted by one that the ancient barony of the Talbots would be revived by the king; and the gratitude of a free and grateful country, with the consciousness of having materially aided in acquiring that independence which should be the birthright of every Englishman, was eloquently portrayed by the other. When to the last plea was added the personal preference of Katharine Wilton, the balance was overcome, and the hopes of the mother were doomed to disappointment.

Using vocabulary and structure from examples, write a short paragraph about 'prehistory' targeting the same readability level (Graduate), limited to 50 words.

Prehistory, the study of human history before written records, is a crucial field for understanding our past. Archaeologists, like detectives, use artifacts and sites to reconstruct cultures and events. This includes the Stone Age, Bronze Age, and Iron Age, each marked by significant technological advancements.

Using vocabulary and structure from examples, write a short paragraph about 'prehistory' targeting the same readability level (Graduate), limited to 50 words. Prehistory is the span of time from the formation of the Earth to the invention of writing.

Prehistory, the earliest era of human existence, predates written records. It spans from Earth's birth to the advent of writing, an epoch shrouded in mystery. Archaeologists and anthropologists delve into this period, piecing together humanity's origins and early cultures through artifacts and genetic evidence.

Prehistory is the span of time before the invention of writing and thus before recorded history. It is studied by anthropologists, archaeologists, historians, and others.
